meanings.definition: A circular area where livestock or other animals are exhibited in competition.
meanings.sent1: The cows paraded around the showring, hoping to impress the judges.
meanings.sent2: The sheep were groomed and ready for the showring competition.
meanings.sent3: The piglet tried to sneak out of the showring, thinking it was a race instead of a display.
meanings.sent4: The showring was a stage where the animals performed their best for the audience.
meanings.sent5: The bright lights of the showring made the animals stand out beautifully.

meanings.definition: To display or exhibit in a showring.
meanings.sent1: The farmer will showring his prize bull at the county fair.
meanings.sent2: She decided to showring her collection of rare birds at the exhibition.
meanings.sent3: The children wanted to showring their talents in the school talent show.
meanings.sent4: He showrings his vintage car at car shows across the country.
meanings.sent5: The artist will showring her latest masterpiece at the gallery opening.

meanings.definition: The act of showing animals in a showring.
meanings.sent1: The showring of the horses was the highlight of the equestrian event.
meanings.sent2: Her dedication to the showring of her pets was truly admirable.
meanings.sent3: The showring of the rabbits turned into a chaotic hopping contest.
meanings.sent4: The showring of the dogs showcased their agility and obedience.
meanings.sent5: The showring of the exotic birds was a colorful spectacle for the audience.
